org.trianacode.taskgraph.service

Class Monitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trianacode.taskgraph.service.Monitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable
    This class is used by the LocalCable class to ensure that all the information that is being sent out of a sending unit is being received by a receiving unit and visa-verse. It does this by using Java monitors to provide the necessary synchronization needed between the sending and receiving units within the the Triana system. There is one monitor set up for each connection (i.e. by using a GAPCable) made.
    See Also:
    LocalCable, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.Object data)
         throws EmptyingException
        The Sending unit calls this method when it has data which is ready to be sent to the receiving unit. The monitor then waits until the unit is ready to receive the data before releasing the data
        Throws:
        EmptyingException

      • putButDontBlock

        public void putButDontBlock(java.lang.Object data)
        This puts the data on this connection but does not block the unit. Instead it puts it in the background and waits in a separate thread

      • block

      • release

        public void release()

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get()
                     throws EmptyingException
        The Receiving unit calls this method when it wants to receive data. It then waits until it is notified that the data is ready to be received.
        Throws:
        EmptyingException

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        The Receiving unit calls this method when it wants to receive data which may or may not be there. If it is available then the unit returns true and then can go ahead and call the get() method to retrieve the date otherwise it return false. This method is used to implement the idea of an optional() connection within Triana e.g. if an input node is marked optional then the unit can quite happily process its information without contribution from this input i.e. the input does not block the unit. However if data is ready at the input then the unit can retrieve it and use it.

        see RunnableUnit#optional

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        When the garbage collector de-allocates space from this object we reset all references to other object we have used
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
